template.name: IIS by Zabbix agent active
template.description:
Get metrics from IIS using Zabbix agent running on Windows
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/401862-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-internet-information-services
Template tooling version used: 0.38

trigger.name: IIS: Port {$IIS.PORT} is down

dependency.name: IIS: The World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) is not running
dependency.expression: last(/IIS by Zabbix agent active/service_state[W3SVC])<>0

item.name: IIS: Anonymous users per second
item.description: The number of requests from users over an anonymous connection per second. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Bytes Received per second
item.description: The average rate per minute at which data bytes are received by the service at the Application Layer. Does not include protocol headers or control bytes.

item.name: IIS: Bytes Sent per second
item.description: The average rate per minute at which data bytes are sent by the service.

item.name: IIS: Bytes Total per second
item.description: The average rate per minute of total bytes/sec transferred by the Web service (sum of bytes sent/sec and bytes received/sec).

item.name: IIS: Method CGI requests per second
item.description: The rate of CGI requests that are simultaneously being processed by the Web service. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Connection attempts per second
item.description: The average rate per minute that connections using the Web service are being attempted. The count is the average for all Web sites combined.

item.name: IIS: Method COPY requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests made using the COPY method. Copy requests are used for copying files and directories. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Current connections
item.description: The number of active connections.

item.name: IIS: Method DELETE requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the DELETE method made. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method Method GET requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests made using the GET method. GET requests are generally used for basic file retrievals or image maps, though they can be used with forms. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method HEAD requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the HEAD method made. HEAD requests generally indicate a client is querying the state of a document they already have to see if it needs to be refreshed. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method ISAPI requests per second
item.description: The rate of ISAPI Extension requests that are simultaneously being processed by the Web service. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Locked errors per second
item.description: The rate of errors due to requests that couldn't be satisfied by the server because the requested document was locked. These are generally reported as an HTTP 423 error code to the client. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method LOCK requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests made using the LOCK method. Lock requests are used to lock a file for one user so that only that user can modify the file. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method MKCOL requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the MKCOL method made. Mkcol requests are used to create directories on the server. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method MOVE requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the MOVE method made. Move requests are used for moving files and directories. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: NonAnonymous users per second
item.description: The number of requests from users over a non-anonymous connection per second. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Not Found errors per second
item.description: The rate of errors due to requests that couldn't be satisfied by the server because the requested document could not be found. These are generally reported to the client with HTTP error code 404. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method OPTIONS requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the OPTIONS method made. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method Total Other requests per second
item.description: Total Other Request Methods is the number of HTTP requests that are not OPTIONS, GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE, TRACE, MOVE, COPY, MKCOL, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, SEARCH, LOCK or UNLOCK methods (since service startup). Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method POST requests per second
item.description: Rate of HTTP requests using POST method. Generally used for forms or gateway requests. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method PROPFIND requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the PROPFIND method made. Propfind requests retrieve property values on files and directories. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method PROPPATCH requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the PROPPATCH method made. Proppatch requests set property values on files and directories. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method PUT requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the PUT method made. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method MS-SEARCH requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the MS-SEARCH method made. Search requests are used to query the server to find resources that match a set of conditions provided by the client. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Uptime
item.description: Service uptime in seconds.

trigger.expression: last(/IIS by Zabbix agent active/perf_counter_en["\Web Service(_Total)\Service Uptime"])<10m
trigger.name: IIS: has been restarted (uptime < 10m)
trigger.description: Uptime is less than 10 minutes

item.name: IIS: Total connection attempts
item.description: The total number of connections to the Web or FTP service that have been attempted since service startup. The count is the total for all Web sites or FTP sites combined.

item.name: IIS: Method Total requests per second
item.description: The rate of all HTTP requests received. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method TRACE requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the TRACE method made. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method TRACE requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the UNLOCK method made. Unlock requests are used to remove locks from files. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Files cache hits percentage
item.description: The ratio of user-mode file cache hits to total cache requests (since service startup). Note: This value might be low if the Kernel URI cache hits percentage is high.

item.name: IIS: File cache misses
item.description: The total number of unsuccessful lookups in the user-mode file cache since service startup.

item.name: IIS: URIs cache hits percentage
item.description: The ratio of user-mode URI Cache Hits to total cache requests (since service startup)

item.name: IIS: URI cache misses
item.description: The total number of unsuccessful lookups in the user-mode URI cache since service startup.

item.name: IIS: World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) state
item.description: The World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) provides web connectivity and administration of websites through the IIS snap-in. If the World Wide Web Publishing Service stops, the operating system cannot serve any form of web request. This service was dependent on "Windows Process Activation Service".

trigger.name: IIS: The World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) is not running
trigger.description: The World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) is not in running state. IIS cannot start.

dependency.name: IIS: Windows process Activation Service (WAS) is not the running
dependency.expression: last(/IIS by Zabbix agent active/service_state[WAS])<>0

item.name: IIS: Windows Process Activation Service (WAS) state
item.description: Windows Process Activation Service (WAS) is a tool for managing worker processes that contain applications that host Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) services. Worker processes handle requests that are sent to a Web Server for specific application pools. Each application pool sets boundaries for the applications it contains.

trigger.name: IIS: Windows process Activation Service (WAS) is not the running
trigger.description: Windows Process Activation Service (WAS) is not in the running state. IIS cannot start.

item_prototype.name: IIS: AppPool {#APPPOOL} state
item_prototype.description: The state of the application pool.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/IIS by Zabbix agent active/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Current Application Pool State"])<>3 and {$IIS.APPPOOL.MONITORED:"{#APPPOOL}"}=1
trigger_prototype.name: IIS: Application pool {#APPPOOL} is not in Running state

item_prototype.name: IIS: {#APPPOOL} Uptime
item_prototype.description: The web application uptime period since the last restart.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/IIS by Zabbix agent active/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Current Application Pool Uptime"])<10m
trigger_prototype.name: IIS: {#APPPOOL} has been restarted (uptime < 10m)

item_prototype.name: IIS: AppPool {#APPPOOL} recycles
item_prototype.description: The number of times the application pool has been recycled since Windows Process Activation Service (WAS) started.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/IIS by Zabbix agent active/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Total Application Pool Recycles"],#1)<>last(/IIS by Zabbix agent active/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Total Application Pool Recycles"],#2) and {$IIS.APPPOOL.MONITORED:"{#APPPOOL}"}=1
trigger_prototype.name: IIS: Application pool {#APPPOOL} has been recycled

item_prototype.name: IIS: AppPool {#APPPOOL} current queue size
item_prototype.description: The number of requests in the queue.

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/IIS by Zabbix agent active/perf_counter_en["\HTTP Service Request Queues({#APPPOOL})\CurrentQueueSize"],{$IIS.QUEUE.MAX.TIME})>{$IIS.QUEUE.MAX.WARN}
trigger_prototype.name: IIS: Request queue of {#APPPOOL} is too large (over {$IIS.QUEUE.MAX.WARN})

dependency.name: IIS: Application pool {#APPPOOL} is not in Running state
dependency.expression: last(/IIS by Zabbix agent active/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Current Application Pool State"])<>3 and {$IIS.APPPOOL.MONITORED:"{#APPPOOL}"}=1

macro.description: This macro is used in application pools discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Monitoring status for discovered application pools. Use context to avoid trigger firing for specific application pools. "1" - enabled, "0" - disabled.
This macro is used in application pools discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
The time during which the queue length may exceed the threshold.
Maximum application pool's request queue length for trigger expression.
The service (http/https/etc) for port check. See "net.tcp.service" documentation page for more information: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/5.4/manual/config/items/itemtypes/simple_checks

template.name: Olos - Dell Compellent
template.description:
Ajustes por Andr Rocha em 14/12/2016.
Reviso do template Storage Dell Compellent (SNMP). Compatvel com Zabbix 2.4.8. No usar "bulk requests" na configurao do host monitorado.
Instalao:
Install echo.something in the ExternalScripts directory of your Zabbix server and/or proxy. Check your zabbix_server.conf and/or zabbix_proxy.conf if in doubt. Then chmod a+x echo.something
Go to Administration -> General -> Value Mapping and create the following maps:
scItemStatus 1 => Up 2 => Down 3 => Degraded
scProductIDGlobalStatus 1 => Other 2 => Unknown 3 => Ok 4 => Noncritical 5 => Critical 6 => Nonrecoverable
scServerCnctvy 1 => Up 2 => Down 3 => Partial
scScStatus 1 => Online 2 => Offline 3 => Unknown
scDiskHealthy 1 => Healthy 2 => Not Healthy 3 => Unknown
scDiskType 1 => FibreChannel 2 => iSCSI 3 => FibreChannelOverEthernet 4 => SAS 5 => Unknown
scHostStatus 0 => Up 2 => Unreachable
SNMP_interface_status 1 => Up 2 => Down 3 => Testing 4 => Unknown 5 => Dormant 6 => NotPresent 7 => LowerLayerDown

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} is UNREACHABLE or DOWN

item.name: QUANTIDADE DE INTERFACES
item.description: The number of network interfaces (regardless of their current state) present on this system.

trigger.name: Global status of {HOST.NAME} is abnormal
Global status of {HOST.NAME} is critical
Global status of {HOST.NAME} is noncritical
Global status of {HOST.NAME} is nonrecoverable
{HOST.NAME} name has changed
{HOST.NAME} has just been restarted

trigger_prototype.expression: {TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and (last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/ifOperStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}],#1)<>last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/ifOperStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}],#2))=1 and last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/ifOperStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])<>1 or {TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/ifOperStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])<>1
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS OPERACIONAL DA INTERFACE {#SNMPVALUE} DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrFanStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 1 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrFanStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 1 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrFanStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 2 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrFanStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 2 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrPowerStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 1 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrPowerStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 1 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrPowerStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 2 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrPowerStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 2 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrTempCurrentC1[{#SNMPVALUE}])>65
trigger_prototype.name: TEMPERATURE SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 1 > $1

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrTempCurrentC2[{#SNMPVALUE}])>65
trigger_prototype.name: TEMPERATURE SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 2 > $1

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrTempStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 1 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrTempStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 1 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrTempStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 2 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtlrTempStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} CONTROLLER 2 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtrlStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: Controller {#SNMPVALUE} is degraded on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scCtrlStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: Controller {#SNMPVALUE} is down on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scDiskHealthy[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPVALUE} is not healthy in {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scDiskStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPVALUE} is degraded {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scDiskStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPVALUE} is down on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclFanStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS FAN {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 1 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclFanStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS FAN {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 1 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclFanStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS FAN {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 2 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclFanStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS FAN {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 2 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure {#SNMPINDEX} named {#SNMPVALUE} is degraded on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure {#SNMPINDEX} named {#SNMPVALUE} is down on {HOST.NAME}

item_prototype.name: Status of Power Supply 1 in Enclosure $1

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclPowerStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS POWER SUPPLY 1 IN ENCLOSURE {#SNMPVALUE} IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclPowerStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS POWER SUPPLY 1 IN ENCLOSURE {#SNMPVALUE} IS DOWN

item_prototype.name: Status of Power Supply 2 in Enclosure {#SNMPVALUE}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclPowerStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS POWER SUPPLY 2 IN ENCLOSURE {#SNMPVALUE} IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclPowerStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS POWER SUPPLY 2 IN ENCLOSURE {#SNMPVALUE} IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclTempCurrentC1[{#SNMPVALUE}])>65
trigger_prototype.name: TEMPERATURE SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 1 >$1

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclTempCurrentC2[{#SNMPVALUE}])>65
trigger_prototype.name: TEMPERATURE SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 2 >$1

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclTempStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 1 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclTempStatus1[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 1 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclTempStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 2 IS DEGRADED

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scEnclTempStatus2[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: STATUS SENSOR {#SNMPVALUE} ENCLOSURE 2 IS DOWN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scServerCnctvy[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: Connectivity of server {#SNMPVALUE} is down on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scServerCnctvy[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: Connectivity of server {#SNMPVALUE} is partial on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scServerPathCount[{#SNMPVALUE}])<1
trigger_prototype.name: Server {#SNMPVALUE} has lost path(s) on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scServerStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: Server {#SNMPVALUE} is degraded on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scServerStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: Server {#SNMPVALUE} is down on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scVolumeStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=3
trigger_prototype.name: Volume {#SNMPVALUE} is degraded on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Dell Compellent/scVolumeStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2
trigger_prototype.name: Volume {#SNMPVALUE} is down on {HOST.NAME}

template.name: Olos - ECOS SNMP
template.description:
## Viso geral
Monitores: uptime do servio, taxa de sesso, chamadas ativas, sesses ativas, sesses de pico, chamadas de pico e nmero de processos Freeswitch. Acionar em muitas chamadas ativas [ou seja, quando voc est ficando sem canais].
Requer que o subagente SNMP mod\_snmp esteja habilitado em Freeswitch+net-snmp.

trigger.name: Maximum concurrent calls reached
trigger.description: Maximum concurrent calls has been reached. Any further call attempts will get busy signal. Buy more SIP channels!

item.name: Ecos peak sessions last five minutes

trigger.name: Ecos service has restarted
trigger.description: Uptime is less than 10 minutes, service has restarted.

template.name: Olos - ICMP Ping
template.description:
Template Module ICMP Ping
Template tooling version used: 0.38

trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping - HIGH
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

trigger.expression: min(/Olos - ICMP Ping/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Olos - ICMP Ping/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping - HIGH
dependency.expression: max(/Olos - ICMP Ping/icmpping,#3)=0

trigger.name: High ICMP ping response time

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/Olos - ICMP Ping/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Olos - ICMP Ping/icmppingloss,5m)<100

dependency.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping - HIGH
dependency.expression: max(/Olos - ICMP Ping/icmpping,#3)=0

template.template: Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB
template.name: Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB

item.name: MS SQL Server: Buffer cache hit ratio in %
item.params: SELECT CONVERT(int,(a.cntr_value * 1.0 / b.cntr_value) * 100) as BufferCacheHitRatio FROM sys.dm_os_performance_counters a JOIN (SELECT cntr_value,OBJECT_NAME FROM sys.dm_os_performance_counters WHERE counter_name = 'Buffer cache hit ratio base' AND OBJECT_NAME like '%:Buffer Manager%') b ON a.OBJECT_NAME = b.OBJECT_NAME WHERE a.counter_name = 'Buffer cache hit ratio' AND a.OBJECT_NAME like '%:Buffer Manager%'
item.description: Monitoring the buffer cache hit raio in %

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[buffer_cache_hit_radio,{$DSN}])<90
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Buffer cache hit radio - {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

item.name: MS SQL Server: callID number
item.description: Numero atual do CallID

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])>=2000000000
trigger.recovery_expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])<2000000000
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - CallID number is {ITEM.VALUE} and need to be reset - DISASTER

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])>=2100000000
trigger.recovery_expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])<2100000000
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - CallID number is {ITEM.VALUE} and need to be reset IMMEDIATELY - DISASTER

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])>=1800000000
trigger.recovery_expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])<1800000000
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - CallID number is {ITEM.VALUE} and will exceed the limit soon - AVERAGE

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])>=1900000000
trigger.recovery_expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])<1900000000
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - CallID number is {ITEM.VALUE} and will exceed the limit soon - HIGH

trigger.expression: nodata(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}],1h)=1
trigger.recovery_expression: nodata(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}],10m)=0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - Stopped receiving data from CallID - DISASTER

item.name: MS SQL Server: Check call_ID
item.params: DECLARE @ReiniciarCallID BIT IF EXISTS(SELECT * FROM sys.databases WITH(NOLOCK) WHERE name = 'CampaignControl') BEGIN SET @ReiniciarCallID = (SELECT TOP 1 1 FROM [CampaignControl].[dbo].[CallControl] WITH(NOLOCK) WHERE CallId >= 2000000000) END SELECT ISNULL(@ReiniciarCallID, 0) AS ZerarCallID
item.description: Alerta de possvel estouro de call_ID

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[check_call_ID,{$DSN}])=1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: CALL ID is exceeding the limit

item.name: MS SQL Server: DB Uptime
item.params: select datediff(SECOND, crdate, getdate()) second from master.dbo.sysdatabases where name = 'tempdb'
item.description: Monitors database uptime

trigger.expression: nodata(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[db_uptime,{$DSN}],10m)=1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: {$DSN} Database is not responding

item.name: MS SQL Server: Full Scans/sec
item.params: select convert(dec(12,0),cntr_value) count from master.dbo.sysperfinfo where counter_name = 'Full Scans/sec'

item.name: MS SQL Server: Latch Waits/sec
item.params: select convert(dec(12,0),cntr_value) count from master.dbo.sysperfinfo where counter_name = 'Latch Waits/sec'

item.name: MS SQL Server: Locks
item.params: select count(*) as Bloqueios from sysprocesses where blocked>0 and waittime/1000> 300 and blocked <> spid

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[locks,{$DSN}])>0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Lock found

item.name: MS SQL Server: Long query text
item.params: With long_queries as (SELECT r.session_id spid, @@SERVERNAME instance_name,DB_NAME(s.database_id) dbname,s.login_name loginname, CONVERT(decimal(15,2),(convert(dec(15,2),r.total_elapsed_time)/1000)/60) elapsed_time, convert(varchar(255),isNull(SUBSTRING (st.text,1,255),'n/a')) as sql_text FROM sys.dm_exec_sessions s, sys.dm_exec_requests r CROSS APPLY sys.dm_exec_sql_text(r.sql_handle) as st WHERE s.session_id = r.session_id and r.status in ('running','runnable') and s.session_id <> @@SPID ) select 'Instancia: '+instance_name+' SPID:'+CONVERT(VARCHAR,spid)+' Login name:'+loginname+' Database:'+dbname+' Query:'+sql_text+' esta em execucao a:'+CONVERT(varchar,elapsed_time)+' minutos.' from long_queries a

item.name: MS SQL Server: Long query time
item.params: DECLARE @long_query_time int = 0 select top 1 @long_query_time = CONVERT(decimal(15,2),(convert(dec(15,2),r.total_elapsed_time)/1000)) FROM sys.dm_exec_sessions s, sys.dm_exec_requests r CROSS APPLY sys.dm_exec_sql_text(r.sql_handle) as st WHERE s.session_id = r.session_id and r.status in ('running','runnable') and s.session_id <> @@SPID order by r.total_elapsed_time desc select case when @long_query_time > 14400 then 1 else 0 end as long_query_time

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[long_query_time,{$DSN}])=1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Have an query is long more 4 hours

item.params: select convert(dec(12,0),cntr_value) count from master.dbo.sysperfinfo where counter_name = 'Optimizer Memory (KB)'

item.name: MS SQL Server: Page life expectancy
item.params: SELECT cntr_value FROM sys.dm_os_performance_counters WHERE [object_name] LIKE '%Buffer Manager%' AND [counter_name] = 'Page life expectancy'

item.name: MS SQL Server: SQL Cache Memory
item.params: select (cntr_value) count from master.sys.dm_os_performance_counters WHERE LTRIM(RTRIM(object_name)) LIKE '%:Memory Manager' AND LTRIM(RTRIM(counter_name)) = 'SQL Cache Memory (KB)'

item.name: MS SQL Server: Total Memory
item.params: select (select (cntr_value*1024) from sys.dm_os_performance_counters where LTRIM(RTRIM(object_name)) LIKE '%:Memory Manager' AND LTRIM(RTRIM(counter_name)) = 'Total Server Memory (KB)') count

item.name: MS SQL Server: User Connections
item.params: select convert(dec(12,0),cntr_value) connections from master.dbo.sysperfinfo where counter_name ='User Connections'

item.name: MS SQL Server: Maximum Workspace Memory (KB)
item.params: select (select (cntr_value*1024) value from sys.dm_os_performance_counters WHERE LTRIM(RTRIM(object_name)) LIKE '%:Memory Manager' AND LTRIM(RTRIM(counter_name)) = 'Maximum Workspace Memory (KB)') maximum

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: MS SQL Server Port {$MSSQLSERVER_PORT} is unavailable

discovery_rule.name: Discovery Jobs SQL Server
discovery_rule.params: SELECT NAME FROM msdb.dbo.sysjobs where enabled = 1

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server Jobs: Status of jobs {#NAME}
item_prototype.params: WITH last_hist_rec AS(SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY job_id ORDER BY run_date DESC, run_time DESC) AS [RowNum], job_id, run_date AS [last_run_date], run_time AS [last_run_time], CASE run_status WHEN 0 THEN '0'WHEN 1 THEN '1' WHEN 2 THEN '2' WHEN 3 THEN '3' WHEN 4 THEN '4' END AS [status] FROM msdb.dbo.sysjobhistory) SELECT hist.status FROM msdb.dbo.sysjobs jobs LEFT JOIN last_hist_rec hist ON hist.job_id = jobs.job_id AND hist.RowNum = 1 WHERE jobs.name = '{#NAME}'

valuemap.name: MS SQL Server - Job Status - EN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[{#NAME}_job_status,{$DSN}])=0
trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME}: Job {#NAME} is FAILURE - HIGH

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: {$DSN} Database is not responding
dependency.expression: nodata(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[db_uptime,{$DSN}],10m)=1

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server Jobs: Job time {#NAME}
item_prototype.params: BEGIN DECLARE @job_interval INT, @job_time int SELECT @job_interval = CASE freq_subday_type WHEN 2 THEN freq_subday_interval WHEN 4 THEN freq_subday_interval * 60 WHEN 8 THEN freq_subday_interval * 3600 ELSE 0 END FROM msdb.dbo.sysjobs j INNER JOIN msdb.dbo.sysjobschedules js ON j.job_id = js.job_id INNER JOIN msdb.dbo.sysschedules ss ON js.schedule_id = ss.schedule_id WHERE j.name = '{#NAME}' AND freq_subday_type = 4 SET @job_interval = ISNULL(@job_interval, 14400) SELECT @job_time = DATEDIFF(SECOND,dms.last_request_start_time,GETDATE()) FROM sys.dm_exec_sessions dms INNER JOIN sys.dm_exec_sessions sp ON dms.session_id = sp.session_id INNER JOIN sys.dm_exec_requests rq ON sp.session_id = rq.session_id INNER JOIN msdb.dbo.sysjobs sj ON STUFF(REVERSE(SUBSTRING(REVERSE(RTRIM(sp.program_name)),11,16)),5,0,'-') = RIGHT(sj.job_id, 17) WHERE sj.name = '{#NAME}' AND sp.session_id <> @@SPID AND sp.program_name LIKE 'SQLAgent - TSQL JobStep %' SET @job_time = ISNULL(@job_time, 0) SELECT CASE WHEN @job_time < (@job_interval * 1.4) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS Jobtimeok END
item_prototype.description: /*Alerta se o job estiver acima de 40% do intervalo agendado*/

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[{#NAME}_job_time,{$DSN}])<>1
trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME}: Job time is long on {#NAME} - HIGH

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: {$DSN} Database is not responding
dependency.expression: nodata(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[db_uptime,{$DSN}],10m)=1

discovery_rule.params: select name as database_name from sys.databases

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Active Users on {#DATABASE_NAME}
item_prototype.params: select cntr_value active_connections from master.sys.dm_os_performance_counters WHERE LTRIM(RTRIM(object_name)) LIKE '%:Databases' AND LTRIM(RTRIM(counter_name)) = 'Active Transactions' and instance_name = '{#DATABASE_NAME}'

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Backup time status on {#DATABASE_NAME}
item_prototype.params: BEGIN SELECT TOP 1 CASE WHEN ISNULL(ABS(DATEDIFF(HOUR, GetDate(), (backup_finish_date))), 0) < ISNULL((CASE WHEN b.name = 'PurgeData' THEN 864 WHEN recovery_model = 'SIMPLE' THEN 28 ELSE 180 END), 0) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END as backupok FROM master.dbo.sysdatabases B LEFT OUTER JOIN msdb.dbo.backupset A ON A.database_name = B.name AND A.type = 'D' WHERE B.name = '{#DATABASE_NAME}' ORDER BY backup_finish_date DESC END
item_prototype.description: /*Retorna se o tempo do ultimo backup esta ok: 28 horas (Simple), 180 hora (FULL) e 864 (base PurgeData)*/

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[{#DATABASE_NAME}_backup_time_status,{$DSN}])<>1
trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME}: Backup time is not OK {#DATABASE_NAME} - {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: Check state {#DATABASE_NAME}
dependency.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[{#DATABASE_NAME}_database_state,{$DSN}])<>0

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Connections on {#DATABASE_NAME}
item_prototype.params: DECLARE @AllConnections TABLE(SPID INT,Status VARCHAR(MAX),LOGIN VARCHAR(MAX),HostName VARCHAR(MAX),BlkBy VARCHAR(MAX),DBName VARCHAR(MAX),Command VARCHAR(MAX),CPUTime INT,DiskIO INT,LastBatch VARCHAR(MAX),ProgramName VARCHAR(MAX),SPID_1 INT,REQUESTID INT)INSERT INTO @AllConnections EXEC sp_who2 SELECT count(*) FROM @AllConnections WHERE DBName = '{#DATABASE_NAME}'

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Differential Backup Status on {#DATABASE_NAME}
item_prototype.params: SELECT ISNULL(Convert(char(10), MAX(backup_finish_date), 101), 'NEVER') as last_backup FROM master.sys.databases B LEFT OUTER JOIN msdb.dbo.backupset A ON A.database_name = B.name AND A.type = 'I' where B.name = '{#DATABASE_NAME}' GROUP BY B.name ORDER BY B.name

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Log File Growths on {#DATABASE_NAME}

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Suspect Pages on {#DATABASE_NAME}
item_prototype.params: SELECT count (A.database_id) pdcount FROM msdb.dbo.suspect_pages A RIGHT OUTER JOIN master.sys.databases B ON A.database_id = B.database_id AND (event_type = 1 OR event_type = 2 OR event_type = 3) where B.name = '{#DATABASE_NAME}' GROUP BY B.name

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[{#DATABASE_NAME}_suspect_pages,{$DSN}])>0

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Transaction backup Status on {#DATABASE_NAME}
item_prototype.params: SELECT ISNULL(ABS(DATEDIFF(SECOND, GetDate(), MAX(backup_finish_date))), -1) as seconds FROM ( SELECT * from master.sys.databases C where C.recovery_model != 3 and name = '{#DATABASE_NAME}' ) B LEFT OUTER JOIN msdb.dbo.backupset A ON A.database_name = B.name AND A.type = 'L' GROUP BY B.name ORDER BY B.name

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Com JOB/db.odbc.select[{#DATABASE_NAME}_transaction_backup_status,{$DSN}])>21600

item.name: MS SQL Server: Buffer cache hit ratio in %
item.params: SELECT CONVERT(int,(a.cntr_value * 1.0 / b.cntr_value) * 100) as BufferCacheHitRatio FROM sys.dm_os_performance_counters a JOIN (SELECT cntr_value,OBJECT_NAME FROM sys.dm_os_performance_counters WHERE counter_name = 'Buffer cache hit ratio base' AND OBJECT_NAME like '%:Buffer Manager%') b ON a.OBJECT_NAME = b.OBJECT_NAME WHERE a.counter_name = 'Buffer cache hit ratio' AND a.OBJECT_NAME like '%:Buffer Manager%'
item.description: Monitoring the buffer cache hit raio in %

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[buffer_cache_hit_radio,{$DSN}])<90
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Buffer cache hit radio - {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

item.name: MS SQL Server: callID number
item.description: Numero atual do CallID

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])>=2000000000
trigger.recovery_expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])<2000000000
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - CallID number is {ITEM.VALUE} and need to be reset - DISASTER

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])>=2100000000
trigger.recovery_expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])<2100000000
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - CallID number is {ITEM.VALUE} and need to be reset IMMEDIATELY - DISASTER

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])>=1800000000
trigger.recovery_expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])<1800000000
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - CallID number is {ITEM.VALUE} and will exceed the limit soon - AVERAGE

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])>=1900000000
trigger.recovery_expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}])<1900000000
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - CallID number is {ITEM.VALUE} and will exceed the limit soon - HIGH

trigger.expression: nodata(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}],1h)=1
trigger.recovery_expression: nodata(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[callID_Number,{$DSN}],10m)=0
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} - Stopped receiving data from CallID - DISASTER

item.name: MS SQL Server: Check call_ID
item.params: DECLARE @ReiniciarCallID BIT IF EXISTS(SELECT * FROM sys.databases WITH(NOLOCK) WHERE name = 'CampaignControl') BEGIN SET @ReiniciarCallID = (SELECT TOP 1 1 FROM [CampaignControl].[dbo].[CallControl] WITH(NOLOCK) WHERE CallId >= 2000000000) END SELECT ISNULL(@ReiniciarCallID, 0) AS ZerarCallID
item.description: Alerta de possvel estouro de call_ID

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[check_call_ID,{$DSN}])=1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: CALL ID is exceeding the limit

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Suspect Pages on {#DATABASE_NAME}
item_prototype.params: SELECT count (A.database_id) pdcount FROM msdb.dbo.suspect_pages A RIGHT OUTER JOIN master.sys.databases B ON A.database_id = B.database_id AND (event_type = 1 OR event_type = 2 OR event_type = 3) where B.name = '{#DATABASE_NAME}' GROUP BY B.name

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[{#DATABASE_NAME}_suspect_pages,{$DSN}])>0
trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME} Suspect Pages on {#DATABASE_NAME} - {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: Check state {#DATABASE_NAME}
dependency.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[{#DATABASE_NAME}_database_state,{$DSN}])<>0

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Transactions/sec on {#DATABASE_NAME}
item_prototype.params: select convert(dec(12,0),cntr_value) count from master.dbo.sysperfinfo where counter_name ='Transactions/sec' and instance_name = '{#DATABASE_NAME}'

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: Transaction backup Status on {#DATABASE_NAME}
item_prototype.params: SELECT ISNULL(ABS(DATEDIFF(SECOND, GetDate(), MAX(backup_finish_date))), -1) as seconds FROM ( SELECT * from master.sys.databases C where C.recovery_model != 3 and name = '{#DATABASE_NAME}' ) B LEFT OUTER JOIN msdb.dbo.backupset A ON A.database_name = B.name AND A.type = 'L' GROUP BY B.name ORDER BY B.name

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[{#DATABASE_NAME}_transaction_backup_status,{$DSN}])>21600
trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME}: Transaction backup Status on {#DATABASE_NAME} - {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

dependency.name: {HOST.NAME}: Check state {#DATABASE_NAME}
dependency.expression: last(/Olos - MS SQL Server - ODBC - Sem JOB/db.odbc.select[{#DATABASE_NAME}_database_state,{$DSN}])<>0

discovery_rule.name: Discovery Login Name
discovery_rule.params: select rtrim(login_name) loginname from sys.dm_exec_sessions where host_name <> '' and program_name <> '' group by login_name

item_prototype.name: MS SQL Server: User CPU on {#LOGINNAME}
item_prototype.params: select sum(cpu_time) cpu_busy from sys.dm_exec_sessions where login_name = '{#LOGINNAME}' and host_name <> '' and program_name <> '' group by login_name

valuemap.name: MS SQL Server - Database Status - EN
MS SQL Server - Job Status - EN

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - SNMP v2c Interfaces/ifOperStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=2 and last(/Olos - SNMP v2c Interfaces/ifAdminStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}])=1
trigger_prototype.name: Operational status changed in {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE} - {#IFALIAS}

template.name: Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces
template.description:
Template Module Interfaces
MIBs used: IF-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.32

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down - DISASTER
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned NumbersAuthority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and ( last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=117 ) and (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down - DISASTER
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) or avg(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) and avg(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down - DISASTER
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or min(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and max(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down - DISASTER
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Olos - SNMP v2c module Interfaces/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)

item.name: Cluster name
item.description: Cluster name of the guest VM.

item.name: CPU usage
item.description: Aggregated CPU usage across all cores on the host in Hz. This is only available if the host is connected.

item.name: Datacenter name
item.description: Datacenter name of the hypervisor.

item.name: Full name
item.description: The complete product name, including the version information.

item.name: CPU frequency
item.description: The speed of the CPU cores. This is an average value if there are multiple speeds. The product of CPU frequency and number of cores is approximately equal to the sum of the MHz for all the individual cores on the host.

item.name: CPU model
item.description: The CPU model.

item.name: CPU cores
item.description: Number of physical CPU cores on the host. Physical CPU cores are the processors contained by a CPU package.

item.name: CPU threads

item.name: Used memory

item.name: Health state rollup
item.description: The host health state rollup sensor value: gray - unknown, ok, red - it has a problem, yellow - it might have a problem.

item.name: Overall status
item.description: The overall alarm status of the host: gray - unknown, ok, red - it has a problem, yellow - it might have a problem.

item.description: System uptime.

item.description: Number of guest virtual machines.

template.template: Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API
template.name: Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API

trigger.expression: (last(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/agent.hostname,#1)<>last(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/agent.hostname,#2))>0
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME}: Host name of zabbix_agentd was changed - INFORMATION

item.name: Agent ping
item.description: The agent always returns 1 for this item. It could be used in combination with nodata() for availability check.

trigger.expression: nodata(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/agent.ping,10m)=1
trigger.recovery_expression: nodata(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/agent.ping,10m)=0
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME}: Zabbix agent is unreachable - DISASTER

trigger.expression: (last(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/agent.version,#1)<>last(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/agent.version,#2))>0
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME}: Version of zabbix_agent(d) was changed - INFORMATION

item.name: Event Viewer API Olos Proxy
item.description: Coleta de logs do Olos Proxy para gerao de alarmes

trigger.expression: find(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/eventlog[Application,Olos Proxy Chat,,,,,],10m,,"Olos Proxy Ura")=1 or find(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/eventlog[Application,Olos Proxy Chat,,,,,],10m,,"Olos Proxy AD")=1 or find(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/eventlog[Application,Olos Proxy Chat,,,,,],10m,,"Olos Proxy Chat")=1 or find(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/eventlog[Application,Olos Proxy Chat,,,,,],10m,,"Olos Proxy Front")=1

trigger.expression: count(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/eventlog[Application,ThreadAvailable = 0,,,,,],1m,,"ThreadAvailable = 0")>1
trigger.recovery_expression: nodata(/Olos - SO Windows Active - APP Cloud - Olos Proxy EventViewer API/eventlog[Application,ThreadAvailable = 0,,,,,],1h)=1

template.template: Olos - SO Windows Active - ECS Cloud
template.name: Olos - SO Windows Active - ECS Cloud

trigger.expression: (last(/Olos - SO Windows Active - ECS Cloud/agent.hostname,#1)<>last(/Olos - SO Windows Active - ECS Cloud/agent.hostname,#2))>0
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME}: Host name of zabbix_agentd was changed - INFORMATION

item.name: Agent ping
item.description: The agent always returns 1 for this item. It could be used in combination with nodata() for availability check.

trigger.expression: nodata(/Olos - SO Windows Active - ECS Cloud/agent.ping,10m)=1
trigger.recovery_expression: nodata(/Olos - SO Windows Active - ECS Cloud/agent.ping,10m)=0
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME}: Zabbix agent is unreachable - DISASTER

trigger.expression: (last(/Olos - SO Windows Active - ECS Cloud/agent.version,#1)<>last(/Olos - SO Windows Active - ECS Cloud/agent.version,#2))>0
trigger.name: {HOSTNAME}: Version of zabbix_agent(d) was changed - INFORMATION

template.template: Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent
template.name: Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent
template.description:
Get metrics from IIS using Zabbix agent running on Windows
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/401862-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-internet-information-services
Template tooling version used: 0.38

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/net.tcp.service[{$IIS.SERVICE},,{$IIS.PORT}])=0
trigger.name: IIS: Port {$IIS.PORT} is down

dependency.name: IIS: The World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) is not running
dependency.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/service_state[W3SVC])<>0

item.name: IIS: Anonymous users per second
item.description: The number of requests from users over an anonymous connection per second. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Bytes Received per second
item.description: The average rate per minute at which data bytes are received by the service at the Application Layer. Does not include protocol headers or control bytes.

item.name: IIS: Bytes Sent per second
item.description: The average rate per minute at which data bytes are sent by the service.

item.name: IIS: Bytes Total per second
item.description: The average rate per minute of total bytes/sec transferred by the Web service (sum of bytes sent/sec and bytes received/sec).

item.name: IIS: Method CGI requests per second
item.description: The rate of CGI requests that are simultaneously being processed by the Web service. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Connection attempts per second
item.description: The average rate per minute that connections using the Web service are being attempted. The count is the average for all Web sites combined.

item.name: IIS: Method COPY requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests made using the COPY method. Copy requests are used for copying files and directories. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Current connections
item.description: The number of active connections.

item.name: IIS: Method DELETE requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the DELETE method made. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method Method GET requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests made using the GET method. GET requests are generally used for basic file retrievals or image maps, though they can be used with forms. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method HEAD requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the HEAD method made. HEAD requests generally indicate a client is querying the state of a document they already have to see if it needs to be refreshed. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method ISAPI requests per second
item.description: The rate of ISAPI Extension requests that are simultaneously being processed by the Web service. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Locked errors per second
item.description: The rate of errors due to requests that couldn't be satisfied by the server because the requested document was locked. These are generally reported as an HTTP 423 error code to the client. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method LOCK requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests made using the LOCK method. Lock requests are used to lock a file for one user so that only that user can modify the file. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method MKCOL requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the MKCOL method made. Mkcol requests are used to create directories on the server. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method MOVE requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the MOVE method made. Move requests are used for moving files and directories. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: NonAnonymous users per second
item.description: The number of requests from users over a non-anonymous connection per second. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Not Found errors per second
item.description: The rate of errors due to requests that couldn't be satisfied by the server because the requested document could not be found. These are generally reported to the client with HTTP error code 404. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method OPTIONS requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the OPTIONS method made. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method Total Other requests per second
item.description: Total Other Request Methods is the number of HTTP requests that are not OPTIONS, GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE, TRACE, MOVE, COPY, MKCOL, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, SEARCH, LOCK or UNLOCK methods (since service startup). Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method POST requests per second
item.description: Rate of HTTP requests using POST method. Generally used for forms or gateway requests. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method PROPFIND requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the PROPFIND method made. Propfind requests retrieve property values on files and directories. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method PROPPATCH requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the PROPPATCH method made. Proppatch requests set property values on files and directories. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method PUT requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the PUT method made. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method MS-SEARCH requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the MS-SEARCH method made. Search requests are used to query the server to find resources that match a set of conditions provided by the client. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Uptime
item.description: Service uptime in seconds.

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/perf_counter_en["\Web Service(_Total)\Service Uptime"])<10m
trigger.name: IIS: has been restarted (uptime < 10m)
trigger.description: Uptime is less than 10 minutes

item.name: IIS: Total connection attempts
item.description: The total number of connections to the Web or FTP service that have been attempted since service startup. The count is the total for all Web sites or FTP sites combined.

item.name: IIS: Method Total requests per second
item.description: The rate of all HTTP requests received. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method TRACE requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the TRACE method made. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Method TRACE requests per second
item.description: The rate of HTTP requests using the UNLOCK method made. Unlock requests are used to remove locks from files. Average per minute.

item.name: IIS: Files cache hits percentage
item.description: The ratio of user-mode file cache hits to total cache requests (since service startup). Note: This value might be low if the Kernel URI cache hits percentage is high.

item.name: IIS: File cache misses
item.description: The total number of unsuccessful lookups in the user-mode file cache since service startup.

item.name: IIS: URIs cache hits percentage
item.description: The ratio of user-mode URI Cache Hits to total cache requests (since service startup)

item.name: IIS: URI cache misses
item.description: The total number of unsuccessful lookups in the user-mode URI cache since service startup.

item.name: IIS: World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) state
item.description: The World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) provides web connectivity and administration of websites through the IIS snap-in. If the World Wide Web Publishing Service stops, the operating system cannot serve any form of web request. This service was dependent on "Windows Process Activation Service".

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/service_state[W3SVC])<>0
trigger.name: IIS: The World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) is not running
trigger.description: The World Wide Web Publishing Service (W3SVC) is not in running state. IIS cannot start.

dependency.name: IIS: Windows process Activation Service (WAS) is not the running
dependency.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/service_state[WAS])<>0

item.name: IIS: Windows Process Activation Service (WAS) state
item.description: Windows Process Activation Service (WAS) is a tool for managing worker processes that contain applications that host Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) services. Worker processes handle requests that are sent to a Web Server for specific application pools. Each application pool sets boundaries for the applications it contains.

trigger.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/service_state[WAS])<>0
trigger.name: IIS: Windows process Activation Service (WAS) is not the running
trigger.description: Windows Process Activation Service (WAS) is not in the running state. IIS cannot start.

item_prototype.name: IIS: AppPool {#APPPOOL} state
item_prototype.description: The state of the application pool.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Current Application Pool State"])<>3 and {$IIS.APPPOOL.MONITORED:"{#APPPOOL}"}=1
trigger_prototype.name: IIS: Application pool {#APPPOOL} is not in Running state

item_prototype.name: IIS: {#APPPOOL} Uptime
item_prototype.description: The web application uptime period since the last restart.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Current Application Pool Uptime"])<10m
trigger_prototype.name: IIS: {#APPPOOL} has been restarted (uptime < 10m)

item_prototype.name: IIS: AppPool {#APPPOOL} recycles
item_prototype.description: The number of times the application pool has been recycled since Windows Process Activation Service (WAS) started.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Total Application Pool Recycles"],#1)<>last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Total Application Pool Recycles"],#2) and {$IIS.APPPOOL.MONITORED:"{#APPPOOL}"}=1
trigger_prototype.name: IIS: Application pool {#APPPOOL} has been recycled

item_prototype.name: IIS: AppPool {#APPPOOL} current queue size
item_prototype.description: The number of requests in the queue.

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/perf_counter_en["\HTTP Service Request Queues({#APPPOOL})\CurrentQueueSize"],{$IIS.QUEUE.MAX.TIME})>{$IIS.QUEUE.MAX.WARN}
trigger_prototype.name: IIS: Request queue of {#APPPOOL} is too large (over {$IIS.QUEUE.MAX.WARN})

dependency.name: IIS: Application pool {#APPPOOL} is not in Running state
dependency.expression: last(/Olos - Windows - App WEB - IIS by Zabbix agent/perf_counter_en["\APP_POOL_WAS({#APPPOOL})\Current Application Pool State"])<>3 and {$IIS.APPPOOL.MONITORED:"{#APPPOOL}"}=1

macro.description: This macro is used in application pools discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Monitoring status for discovered application pools. Use context to avoid trigger firing for specific application pools. "1" - enabled, "0" - disabled.
This macro is used in application pools discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
The time during which the queue length may exceed the threshold.
Maximum application pool's request queue length for trigger expression.
The service (http/https/etc) for port check. See "net.tcp.service" documentation page for more information: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/5.4/manual/config/items/itemtypes/simple_checks

item.name: Zabbix server: Queue over 10 minutes
item.description: Number of monitored items in the queue which are delayed at least by 10 minutes

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 100 items having missing data for more than 10 minutes
trigger.description: zabbix[stats,{$IP},{$PORT},queue,10m] item is collecting data about how many items are missing data for more than 10 minutes

item.name: Zabbix server: Queue
item.description: Number of monitored items in the queue which are delayed at least by 6 seconds

item.name: Zabbix server: Configuration cache, % used
item.description: Availability statistics of Zabbix configuration cache. Percentage of used buffer

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 75% used in the configuration cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing CacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

dependency.name: Zabbix server: More than 80% used in the configuration cache
dependency.expression: max(/Zabbix server health/zabbix[rcache,buffer,pused],10m)>80

dependency.name: Zabbix server: More than 90% used in the configuration cache
dependency.expression: max(/Zabbix server health/zabbix[rcache,buffer,pused],10m)>90

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 80% used in the configuration cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing CacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 90% used in the configuration cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing CacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

item.name: Zabbix server: Trend function cache, % unique requests
item.description: Effectiveness statistics of the Zabbix trend function cache. Percentage of cached items from cached items + requests. Low percentage most likely means that the cache size can be reduced.

item.name: Zabbix server: Trend function cache, % misses
item.description: Effectiveness statistics of the Zabbix trend function cache.Percentage of cache misses

item.name: Zabbix server: Value cache, % used
item.description: Availability statistics of Zabbix value cache.Percentage of used buffer

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 95% used in the value cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing ValueCacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

item.name: Zabbix server: Value cache hits
item.description: Effectiveness statistics of Zabbix value cache. Number of cache hits (history values taken from the cache)

item.name: Zabbix server: Value cache misses
item.description: Effectiveness statistics of Zabbix value cache. Number of cache misses (history values taken from the database)

item.name: Zabbix server: Value cache operating mode
item.description: Value cache operating mode

trigger.name: Zabbix server: Zabbix value cache working in low memory mode
trigger.description: Once the low memory mode has been switched on, the value cache will remain in this state for 24 hours, even if the problem that triggered this mode is resolved sooner.

item.name: Zabbix server: Version
item.description: Version of Zabbix server.

trigger.expression: last(/Zabbix server health/zabbix[version],#1)<>last(/Zabbix server health/zabbix[version],#2) and length(last(/Zabbix server health/zabbix[version]))>0
trigger.name: Zabbix server: Version has changed (new version: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Zabbix server version has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Zabbix server: VMware cache, % used
item.description: Availability statistics of Zabbix vmware cache. Percentage of used buffer

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 75% used in the vmware cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing VMwareCacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

item.name: Zabbix server: History write cache, % used
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Percentage of used history buffer. History cache is used to store item values. A high number indicates performance problems on the database side.

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 75% used in the history cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing HistoryCacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

dependency.name: Zabbix server: More than 80% used in the history cache
dependency.expression: max(/Zabbix server health/zabbix[wcache,history,pused],10m)>80

dependency.name: Zabbix server: More than 90% used in the history cache
dependency.expression: max(/Zabbix server health/zabbix[wcache,history,pused],10m)>90

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 80% used in the history cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing HistoryCacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 90% used in the history cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing HistoryCacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

item.name: Zabbix server: History index cache, % used
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Percentage of used history index buffer. History index cache is used to index values stored in history cache.

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 75% used in the history index cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing HistoryIndexCacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

item.name: Zabbix server: Trend write cache, % used
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Percentage of used trend buffer. Trend cache stores aggregate for the current hour for all items that receive data.

trigger.name: Zabbix server: More than 75% used in the trends cache
trigger.description: Consider increasing TrendCacheSize in the zabbix_server.conf configuration file

item.name: Zabbix server: Number of processed numeric (float) values per second
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Number of processed float values.

item.name: Zabbix server: Number of processed log values per second
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Number of processed log values.

item.name: Zabbix server: Number of processed not supported values per second
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Number of times item processing resulted in item becoming unsupported or keeping that state.

item.name: Zabbix server: Number of processed character values per second
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Number of processed character/string values.

item.name: Zabbix server: Number of processed text values per second
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Number of processed text values.

item.name: Zabbix server: Number of processed numeric (unsigned) values per second
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Number of processed numeric (unsigned) values.

item.name: Zabbix server: Number of processed values per second
item.description: Statistics and availability of Zabbix write cache. Total number of values processed by Zabbix server or Zabbix proxy, except unsupported items.
